notes.title: CISA Disclaimer

notes.text: CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Minimize network exposure for all control system devices and/or systems, ensuring they are not accessible from the internet.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Locate control system networks and remote devices behind firewalls and isolating them from business networks.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: When remote access is required, use more secure methods, such as Virtual Private Networks (VPNs). Recognize VPNs may have vulnerabilities, should be updated to the most recent version available, and are only as secure as the connected devices.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage on cisa.gov. Several CISA products detailing cyber defense best practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA encourages organizations to implement recommended cybersecurity strategies for proactive defense of ICS assets.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage at cisa.gov in the technical information paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing suspected malicious activity should follow established internal procedures and report findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: CISA also recommends users take the following measures to protect themselves from social engineering attacks: Do not click web links or open attachments in unsolicited email messages. Refer to Recognizing and Avoiding Email Scams for more information on avoiding email scams. Refer to Avoiding Social Engineering and Phishing Attacks for more information on social engineering attacks.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

document.title: SMA Solar Technology AG Sunny WebBox Hard-Coded Account Vulnerability

product.name: SMA Solar Technology Sunny WebBox: vers:all/*

notes.text: SMA Solar Sunny WebBox has hardcoded passwords, which makes it easier for remote attackers to obtain access via unspecified vectors.
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: SMA Solar Technology AG has sent out security recommendations via its Sunny Portal Online Platform to WebBox users. SMA expressly recommends deactivation of port-forwarding or use of a VPN to access these devices remotely. Please refer to the Sunny Portal Online Platform or contact SMA customer service for more information: Phone: 1-888-4SMAUSA  Email: (mailto:Info@SMA-America.com)
